newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile stocks seen lower on economic growth data.
newsitem.headline: Chile stocks seen lower on economic growth data.

text.p: Chilean blue chips are expected to open lower on fears that figures showing economic growth picked up strongly in April could delay a further Central Bank interest rate cut, said traders.
"The market will probably react negatively as the growth potentially compromise another rate cut," said David Hurd, head of research at Merrill Lynch.
The government's Imacec index showed the economy grew 6.5 percent in April compared with 3.4 percent in March.
The figure was at the upper end of the 5.5 percent to seven percent range expected by analysts.
Profit-taking is expected to continue undermining the market, especially electricity shares which were among the top gainers in the recent rally.
The blue-chip IPSA index ended last week down 2.4 percent at 132.9 points.
